text: <@U06G1SL316D> Using API is not possible at the moment, But this is possible in the hub private apps sections, please refer the doc <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps?uuid=282eb11e-c327-48f7-970c-faad42943116>
We ensure HubSpot users are also contacts, opening up many options for custom properties for different use cases

HOW are you supposed to work with this API?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions?uuid=437105cc-25fc-4246-9a5a-9e08a24c7cfe>

The documentation refers to developer API key which is deprecated, so I read in some other thread that you can try “apikey=xxx” instead of hapikey, but that gives an error saying “The API key provided is invalid”. So I tried using a private app token, but that also does not work. So I tried creating a public app using my dev portal, but that ALSO does not work.

I’m at a loss here, HOW are you supposed to work with this API?

<@U010UTUAFUL>

You can find the api key in the HubSpot developer account login, I think you are using your default HubSpot account api key. Login into HubSpot developer account, Go to apps menu, in the right side click `Get hubSpot API Key` button
If you know the properties list no need 2 api calls, else you can get the object properties list api and extract the properties then hit the api
there is another property called Total Contract Value that you can use as a trigger and update the amount to equal that.
hmmm.... can you use the hubL filter |upper to convert and then compare?
I don't think so.
good find, thanks Scott
Surfacing this again to see if anyone has ideas. :upvote-bounce:
Thank you Aruljothi, that key works. and is not what I expected, but great that there is a solution :slightly_smiling_face:

hi folks, does anyone has experience syncing `lifecycle stage` property as offline conversions on Google Ads? From what I understand, we can either sync lifecycle stage or form submission to google ads, but lifecycle stage is much easier for us to customize for reporting.

Our problem is that we have 2 separate products with identical lifecycle stages, but we still want to know which product was converted on Google ads platform. Our current solution is to create 2 sets of lifecycle stage values (for example `MQL product A`, `MQL product B`, and so on), but I wonder if there is a more elegant way to do this, for example syncing an extra property (`product type`) to google ads?
<@U01QVR44MEY> You're my go-to answer guy here :joy:  Any thoughts on this?
hey hey bro
So if the pre-populate contact fields with known values is turned on this should work
If that's not working, then I have a couple of questions. How are you setting up the form code in your custom app?
I should clarify that the app would be outside of HubSpot (have their own mobile app and an Admin Panel with that)

From what I understand, their dev team is planning to create a HubSpot form to embed in the app, but pull known fields from the admin panel if they can. If that isn't possible, they are looking instead to just send the data to HubSpot through the forms api
yeah you can pull the currently known values using the HubSpot embed code
but you could also just build it completely custom

Hi! Does anyone know if the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversation/visitor-identification|Visitor Identification API> can be used to show/hide CTAs? From my testing, it doesn’t look like it’s working with CTAs, and the docs are all about chatflows, but wanted to ask in case someone else has had success here. Thanks!!
<#C2YHAHB6K|api> anyone know if theres a webhook for a new blog post being created?
nope
Sorry, I know. There is no webhook for this
the api is to identify users from a webapp or some other authenticated service — and let HubSpot know who they are
what are you trying to do?

if you are trying to not show certain CTAs for certain users, it might be useful to use smart content or use lists to group users, and not display CTAs based upon that

However, Im not sure what you are actually trying to do, is this in an app? or on a hubspto website?
Hi nicholas, thanks for taking a look at this! This is a web app that uses HubSpot to show CTAs
and what are the requirements to show or to hide a cta?
I want to show users that are logged in to the web app CTA #1 and users that _aren’t_ logged in to the web app CTA #2

That sounds like your logged in status would come from the webapp — so you would just use an if statement to determine that and use the CTA embed codes for cta1 and cta2
?
YES, absolutely… that sounds way simpler than trying to tell HubSpot if my user is logged in/out!
I haven’t worked with CTA embed codes, but will definitely check that out
<https://share.zight.com/OAuNBlqe>
super simple
AMAZING
to get to that page, Marketing, Lead Capture, CTAs
can you send “PRODUCT A - {{ lifecycle stage }}”  “PRODUCT B - {{ lifecycle stage }}”
er, am I missing something? I don’t see that ‘embed code’ option
that is a slide in — those have specific ways that they work
they aren’t embedable
ah bummer
When I need to make those types of ctas in a webapp, I make the static cta in HubSpot
then add that transition / css / js into the webapp, wiht the embeded cta inside that container
oooo ok ok, that sounds doable! just thinking about the targeting rules that the business folks want for this :thinking_face:
THANK YOU!! this feels like a way better approach than the path I was going down!
good luck!
haha thanks!
<@U25PYL3Q8> for the win!!

As Nick said, nope. You would just need to poll the endpoint to see new content. 

Easier is using the RSS to see new content.

Hi,
Does anyone know how can I retrieve the Deal Owner not the (Customer Name) from the HubSpot API ?

Thanks in advance <#C2YHAHB6K|api>
yeah, I think that is likely the best option unless you want to watch changes on your blog listing page
deal owner is a property on the deal api. You can call that to get the deal owner. If you want to cross reference that with the owners api, then you will have everything you need
is there any youtube channel for api study for huspot ?
